title: Uninstalling Bitwarden Cleanly on Pop!_OS 24.04
context: After upgrading Pop!_OS from 22.04 to 24.04, Bitwarden stopped launching correctly. The goal was to uninstall it completely using the terminal.
keyIdea: Determine whether Bitwarden is installed via apt, Flatpak, or Snap, and use the correct removal method to avoid leftover configs or dependency issues.
commands:
# Detect installation method
apt list --installed | grep -i bitwarden
flatpak list | grep -i bitwarden
snap list | grep -i bitwarden

# Uninstall (APT)
sudo apt remove --purge bitwarden
sudo apt autoremove

# Uninstall (Flatpak)
flatpak uninstall com.bitwarden.desktop
flatpak uninstall --unused

# Uninstall (Snap)
sudo snap remove bitwarden

# Clean up configs (optional)
rm -rf ~/.config/Bitwarden
rm -rf ~/.var/app/com.bitwarden.desktop
explanation: System upgrades can break GUI app integrations. Bitwarden can exist under multiple package systems. Detecting and removing the right one ensures no partial installations remain.

reusabilityNotes.whenToReuse: Reuse this process for any app behaving oddly after a major upgrade.
reusabilityNotes.pitfalls: Be cautious with `rm -rf` â€” always double-check paths before removing configs.
